articles.title: Kim Jong Un Goes Round Completed Mirae Scientists Street
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un Goes Round Completed Mirae Scientists Street
 Pyongyang, October 21 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Un, first secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea, first chairman of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK and supreme commander of the Korean People's Army, went round Mirae Scientists Street, which was successfully completed as a model of Juche-oriented architecture and fairy street in the era of the Workers' Party. 
					 Feasting his eyes on the street, he said the longer one watches it, the more magnificent and spectacular it looks. He noted with pleasure that it proves visually the idea of the Workers' Party of Korea of attaching importance to science and talents, it is a fashionable street of perfect combination of the Juche character, national identity, originality and formative art and unique one of our style which appeared in the capital city of Pyongyang as an icon of cultural efflorescence. 
					
					 He said it is something unimaginable to build a street with flats for thousands of families and more than 150 public catering outlets in a matter of just one year by the existing method of construction. He noted with excitement that the completion of Mirae Scientists Street convinces everybody that the appearance of the country would undergo beyond recognition a decade later as everything is done in just one year instead of ten years. 
					
					 Going round different places of the street, he learned in detail about the construction. 
					
					 He said that it is fantastic, indeed, to watch the tower symbolic of the 53-storied skyscraper which has been built like an electronic track so that one may know it is Mirae Scientists Street even from distance, adding that formative art was applied to all the buildings at a very high level. 
					
					 He was pleased that the flats have been constructed at the best quality and teachers and researchers would need to bring with them only hand luggage as their drawing rooms, parents' rooms, rooms for couples, children's rooms, kitchens, etc. are fitted with high-quality furniture and fixtures, 
					
					 Hearing officials say foreigners will hardly believe that ordinary educators and scientists of the country will live free of charge in such deluxe apartment houses in the street on the picturesque bank of the Taedong River, he said that it is the advantages of the socialist system in the DPRK which capitalist countries can neither imitate nor build. 
					
					 He praised the builders for having built all kinds of public catering and cultural and welfare establishments on the ground floors of the buildings in an impeccable manner to meet requirements of settlers. 
					
					 He noted with appreciation that resting places and sporting parks have been built in a peculiar style so that residents might have good rest and do sports and greening in the residential area and the project for reinforcing banks of the river were done very well. 
					
					 It is the steadfast will of our party to consolidate the foundation of socialism by dint of science and advance socialism with the power of the engine of science, he said, stressing the need to steadily increase substantial investment in the scientific researches on the basis of the successes and experience gained in the work for consolidating the material and technical foundations of different scientific research bases and improving the living standard of the scientists and researchers in recent years. 
					
					 All the buildings of the street spruced up at a speed unprecedented in the history of construction are laudable structures of Songun Korea built by our service personnel and people with the will to create everything dear in their own style by their own efforts at a lightning speed, optimistic about the future, and they are valuable crystal of their patriotism, he said, extending thanks to the units of the Korean People's Army and other units which participated in the construction, builders and helpers in the name of the Workers' Party of Korea. 
					
					 He expressed expectation and belief that all the builders would give fullest play to the inexhaustible mental power displayed in the construction of Mirae Scientists Street and make a positive contribution to turning Pyongyang City into a hub of Songun culture and the most magnificent and fashionable city of the world fame in all aspects and building the socialist country into a highly civilized nation. 
					
					 He gave an instruction on inaugurating the street.
					
					 He was accompanied by Hwang Pyong So, Kim Ki Nam, Kim Yang Gon, O Su Yong, Jo Yong Won and Ma Won Chun.

articles.title: Credentials to Kim Yong Nam from Indian Ambassador
articles.content:
Credentials to Kim Yong Nam from Indian Ambassador
 Pyongyang, October 21 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, received credentials from Jasminder Kasturia, Indian ambassador to the DPRK, at the Mansudae Assembly Hall on Wednesday.

articles.title: Pak Yong Sik Meets Vietnamese Delegation
articles.content:
Pak Yong Sik Meets Vietnamese Delegation
 Pyongyang, October 21 (KCNA) -- General of the Korean People's Army Pak Yong Sik, minister of the People's Armed Forces, had a talk with a delegation of political officials of the Vietnam People's Army headed by Deputy Head of its General Political Department Nguyen Trong Nghia which paid a courtesy call on him on Wednesday.
					 Present there were Lieutenant General Ryom Chol Song and other generals and officers of the Korean People's Army, and Le Duy Long, military attache of the Vietnamese embassy here.

articles.title: Choe Thae Bok Meets German Delegation
articles.content:
Choe Thae Bok Meets German Delegation
 Pyongyang, October 21 (KCNA) -- Choe Thae Bok, chairman of the Supreme People's Assembly (SPA), had a talk with a delegation of the German-Korean Parliamentary Friendship Group led by Chairman Hartmut Koschyk which paid a courtesy call on him at the Mansudae Assembly Hall on Wednesday.

articles.title: Director of Regional Office for Southeast Asia of WHO Leaves
articles.content:
Director of Regional Office for Southeast Asia of WHO Leaves
 Pyongyang, October 21 (KCNA) -- Poonam Khetrapal Singh, director of the Regional Office for Southeast Asia of the WHO, and his companion left here on Wednesday after participating in the WHO Southeast Asian regional workshop on traditional medicine.

articles.title: National Symposium on Medical Science Held
articles.content:
National Symposium on Medical Science Held
 Pyongyang, October 21 (KCNA) -- A national symposium on medical science took place here on Oct. 20 and 21 to mark the 70th founding anniversary of the Workers' Party of Korea.
					 It was held, being divided into panels of internal medicine, surgery, Koryo medicine, basic medicine, pharmacy and hygiene and anti-epidemics.
					
					 Published at the symposium were more than 360 papers on the successes made by teachers, researchers and medical workers in the public health domain in the medical treatment of patients and in the work of putting preventive and curative medical care and management and operation of public health institutions on an IT basis.

articles.title: Sports Contest of Diplomatic Corps Begins in DPRK
articles.content:
Sports Contest of Diplomatic Corps Begins in DPRK
 Pyongyang, October 21 (KCNA) -- A sports contest of diplomatic corps in the DPRK has begun at the Rungna People's Sports Park here on Wednesday.
					 In this regard, Song Ki Chol, a section chief of the DPRK Foreign Ministry, told KCNA:
					
					 The contest is attended by teams of Russian, Mongolian, Chinese embassies and teams of Asian countries, European countries and UN missions here.
					
					 Football, volleyball and basketball games are to be held on a knock-out basis.
					
					 In the preliminary volleyball matches, teams of Russian and Mongolian embassies and UN missions won by 2:0 against their rivals respectively. 
					
					 The contest will run until Sunday and colorful amusement games are planned to be held that day.

articles.title: DPRK Marks World Statistics Day 2015
articles.content:
DPRK Marks World Statistics Day 2015
 Pyongyang, October 21 (KCNA) -- A dissemination of SDHS 2014 results took place at the Taedonggang Diplomatic Club here on Tuesday to mark the World Statistics Day 2015.
					 Made at the dissemination were speeches on such subjects as "Key Highlights from the Survey", "SDHS over View and Validation of Inter-Censal Household Listing" and "Household Particulars and Social, Economic Characteristics of the Population".
					
					 Speakers elaborated on the results of SDHS 2014 conducted by the Central Bureau of Statistics and the Population Center of the DPRK in cooperation with UNFPA.
					
					 Jang Myong Son, section chief of the Central Bureau of Statistics, told KCNA that SDHS 2014 results show the population and reproductive health conditions in the DPRK. The survey collected for the first time data on the population aging-self perceived health status of elderly, he said.
					
					 Present at the dissemination were officials of the Central Bureau of Statistics and the Population Centre of the DPRK, the country director for UNFPA to the DPRK, office members of international bodies and envoys and staff members of various embassies here.
					
					 The theme of the World Statistics Day 2015 is "Better Data, Better Lives".

articles.title: Friendship Meeting Hosted by Cambodian Ambassador
articles.content:
Friendship Meeting Hosted by Cambodian Ambassador
 Pyongyang, October 21 (KCNA) -- Op Sisawada, Cambodian ambassador to the DPRK, hosted a friendship meeting at his embassy on Wednesday on the occasion of the 62nd independence day of Cambodia.
					 Present there on invitation were Pak Kyong Il, vice-chairman of the Korea-Cambodia Friendship Association, and officials concerned.
					
					 The participants talked with each other about boosting the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries. They planted trees.

articles.title: Members of Pyongyang Mission of AINDF Visit Sinchon Museum
articles.content:
Members of Pyongyang Mission of AINDF Visit Sinchon Museum
 Pyongyang, October 21 (KCNA) -- Chief Jo Il Min and members of the Pyongyang mission of the Anti-Imperialist National Democratic Front (AINDF) visited the Sinchon Museum on Wednesday.
					 They laid bouquets before the tomb of 400 mothers and the tomb of 102 children and paid silent tribute to them.
					
					 They went round rooms of the museum, powder magazine, former air-raid shelter of the Sinchon County Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea, etc., being briefed on the fact that the U.S. imperialists and the class enemies cruelly killed many patriots and innocent people in Sinchon County during the past Fatherland Liberation War. 
					
					 At the end of the visit the chief said the shuddering and terrible massacres committed in Sinchon were unprecedented ones and such brutal acts by the wolf-like U.S. imperialists are lashing all visitors into a great fury. 
					
					 The U.S. imperialists are still unhesitatingly committing crimes against humanity in various parts of south Korea and persist in escalating confrontation with the DPRK, he added. 
					
					 The vanguard fighters of the AINDF and patriotic people in the south will positively turn out in the just and sacred struggle to pull the U.S. imperialist aggressor forces out of south Korea and achieve the national reunification, a long-cherished desire of all Koreans.

articles.title: Greetings to Kim Jong Un from General Secretary of C.C., Congolese Party of Labor
articles.content:
Greetings to Kim Jong Un from General Secretary of C.C., Congolese Party of Labor
 Pyongyang, October 21 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Un, first secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea, received a message of greeting from Pierre Ngolo, general secretary of the Central Committee of the Congolese Party of Labor, on Oct. 7.
					 The general secretary in his message extended warm congratulations to Kim Jong Un on the occasion of the 70th founding anniversary of the Workers' Party of Korea on behalf of the Congolese Party of Labor and President Denis Sassou-Nguesso and on his own behalf.
					
					 The beautiful DPRK has made very remarkable development in the work for wellbeing and prosperity of its people under the leadership of the WPK, the message said.
					
					 It reaffirmed the will of the Congolese Party of Labor to strengthen the relations of friendship, cooperation and solidarity between the two parties and the two peoples.

articles.title: Vietnamese Delegation Pays Tribute to Kim Il Sung, Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
Vietnamese Delegation Pays Tribute to Kim Il Sung, Kim Jong Il
 Pyongyang, October 21 (KCNA) -- A delegation of political officials of the Vietnam People's Army headed by Deputy Head of its General Political Department Nguyen Trong Nghia visited the Kumsusan Palace of the Sun on Wednesday.
					 The guests paid tribute to President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il before their statues at the palace.
					
					 They made a bow to the great leaders who lie in state.
					
					 They went round the halls in which orders the great leaders received are on display and halls which house cars, an electric car, boat and train coaches used by them during their field guidance and foreign tours till the last moments of their lives.

articles.title: Floral Tribute Paid to DPRK Martyrs by Vietnamese Delegation
articles.content:
Floral Tribute Paid to DPRK Martyrs by Vietnamese Delegation
 Pyongyang, October 21 (KCNA) -- A delegation of political officials of the Vietnam People's Army headed by Deputy Head of its General Political Department Nguyen Trong Nghia Wednesday laid wreaths at the Revolutionary Martyrs Cemetery on Mt. Taesong and the Fatherland Liberation War Martyrs Cemetery.
					 Members of the delegation laid bouquets before the bust of anti-Japanese war hero Kim Jong Suk at the revolutionary martyrs cemetery and observed a moment's silence in memory of her.
					
					 Wreaths in the name of the delegation were laid at the cemeteries.
					
					 The guests paid silent tribute to the memory of anti-Japanese revolutionary fighters and martyrs of the Korean People's Army.
					
					 They went round the cemeteries.

articles.title: Tribute Paid to Kim Il Sung, Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
Tribute Paid to Kim Il Sung, Kim Jong Il
 Pyongyang, October 21 (KCNA) -- Members of the youth shock brigade and builders who performed labor feats in the construction of the Paektusan Hero Youth Power Station visited the Kumsusan Palace of the Sun on Wednesday.
					 They paid tribute to President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il before their statues at the palace.
					
					 They made bows to the great leaders who lie in state.
					
					 They went round the halls in which orders the great leaders received are on display and halls which house cars, electric car, boat and train coaches used by them during their field guidance and foreign tours till the last moments of their lives.

articles.title: Floral Baskets Laid before Statues of Kim Il Sung, Kim Jong Il by Participants in Sports Contest
articles.content:
Floral Baskets Laid before Statues of Kim Il Sung, Kim Jong Il by Participants in Sports Contest
 Pyongyang, October 21 (KCNA) -- The participants in the 2015 Inter-provincial Mass Sports Contest on Wednesday laid a floral basket and bouquets before the statues of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il on Mansu Hill and paid tribute to them.

articles.title: Floral Baskets Laid before Statues of Kim Il Sung, Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
Floral Baskets Laid before Statues of Kim Il Sung, Kim Jong Il
 Pyongyang, October 21 (KCNA) -- The participants in the Pyongyang medical science symposium on neurosurgery visited the statues of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il on Mansu Hill on Wednesday.
					 They laid a floral basket and bouquets before the statues of the great leaders and paid tribute to them.
					
					 Meanwhile, a delegation of the Fukuoka Prefectural Japan－DPRK Friendship Association led by Vice Chairman Kenki Nakamura paid tribute to the great leaders before their statues.

articles.title: Delegations of Koreans in U.S. Leave
articles.content:
Delegations of Koreans in U.S. Leave
 Pyongyang, October 21 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the Federation of Koreans in the U.S. headed by Chairman Yun Kil Sang and a delegation of Minjok Thongsin, an internet paper of Koreans in the U.S., headed by representative Ro Kil Nam left here on Wednesday.

articles.title: New Shoe-chest Producing Technology Developed
articles.content:
New Shoe-chest Producing Technology Developed
 Pyongyang, October 21 (KCNA) -- The Footwear Institute under the Management Bureau for the Shoe-making Industry in the DPRK developed a new technology of producing chest of winter shoes with domestic materials.
					 This new method of producing shoe chest does not need raw and synthetic rubber and curing agent. It is of high economic value as it helps prolong the durability of product with less production cost.
					
					 The technology won a high appraisal at the national exhibition of inventions and new technologies recently held to mark the 70th anniversaries of the Workers' Party of Korea and Korea's liberation.

articles.title: Competent Int'l Referees of DPRK
articles.content:
Competent Int'l Referees of DPRK
 Pyongyang, October 21 (KCNA) -- Ri Hyang Ok and Hong Kum Nyo of the DPRK are FIFA women referees, who played an active role in the Women's World Cup in June.
					 Ri and Hong have shown their high competence as referees in more than 150 international football games.
					
					 They had also made a signal contribution to the development of the DPRK women football.
					
					 Ri played a leading role for the DPRK teams winning the 13th and 14th Asian Women's Football Championships and the women football event of the 14th Asian Games. She obtained the qualification for FIFA referee in 2007.
					
					 Hong had been active as a forward and a midfielder of the DPRK team for 10-odd years. She became a FIFA referee in 2002.

articles.title: KCNA Commentary Accuses S. Korean Chief Executive of Her Anti-DPRK Remarks during Foreign Tour
articles.content:
KCNA Commentary Accuses S. Korean Chief Executive of Her Anti-DPRK Remarks during Foreign Tour
 Pyongyang, October 21 (KCNA) -- The south Korean chief executive's recent junket to the U.S. is under fire by Koreans for her sycophancy towards the U.S. and remarks escalating confrontation with compatriots.
					 During her junket, she, together with the U.S. president, adopted a "joint statement on the north", and at a joint press conference she talked volumes about "nuclear weapons and human rights issues in the north."
					
					 The joint statement called on the U.S. and south Korea to "modernize their alliance in a sustainable manner and closely cooperate with each other to cope with the north's provocations of all forms." At a press conference the U.S. master and the south Korean colonial servant  chimed in with the issue of ratcheting up confrontation with the DPRK, blustering that they would not recognize the DPRK as a nuclear weapons state and that its "human rights performance" is deplorable and crying out for slapping "harsher sanctions against it". 
					
					 Disgusting, indeed, is the behavior of the south Korean chief executive as she is scuttling the important affair of the nation in league with outsiders, chilling the hard-won atmosphere of the north-south reconciliation.
					
					 In a nutshell, she made the junket to the U.S., prompted by her politically narrow-minded sycophancy towards outsiders and confrontation with compatriots.
					
					 Explicitly speaking once again, the capabilities for self-defence including its nuclear weapons and missiles the DPRK acquired by tightening its belt serve as a treasure common to all Koreans in the north, the south and abroad. It is thanks to these capabilities that the Koreans live on this land free from war and dispute.
					
					 To urge the DPRK to dismantle its nuclear weapons and missiles is little short of urging it to drop its independent stand and dignity and become slaves of the imperialists.
					
					 Park Geun Hye, since she took office, has cried out for pressurizing the DPRK to dismantle its nuclear weapons, a treasured sword for self-defence guaranteeing peace and security of the nation, while keeping mum about the nuclear weapons and missiles of the U.S. that have plunged the Korean Peninsula into the constant danger of war.
					
					 If there are any provocation and threat to the peninsula, they are only provocation and threat of aggression on the north by the U.S. and the south Korean regime, its ally.
					
					 The U.S. and the south Korean warmongers are massively reinforcing armed forces and staging joint military drills, openly crying out for making a preemptive nuclear strike at the DPRK after mapping out an operation plan in which "strike at its headquarters" was made an established fact. All these moves are bringing the danger of war to the Korean Peninsula. 
					
					 The south Korean chief executive during her junket eagerly asked the U.S., the architect of Korea's division and chieftain of war, to handle the nuclear issue of the DPRK with utmost urgency and the strongest will, raising a hue and cry over "threat" and "provocation." 
					
					 Her behavior reminds one of a mere child knowing nothing of the world, to say nothing of the issue of the north-south relations.
					
					 The cheers of hurrah that resounded at the military parade and public procession of Pyongyang citizens for marking the 70th founding anniversary of the Workers' Party of Korea represented the single-minded unity of the service personnel and people of the DPRK which is stronger than nuclear weapons and a true picture of the invincible DPRK. 
					
					 Park is unable to escape an ill-fame as a traitor to the nation as she was politically short-sighted when she hurt compatriots, clinging to the coattails of outsiders quite contrary to the trend of the era of independence.
					
					 The south Korean regime had better bear in mind the lesson drawn from the miserable ends met by those keen on confrontation.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Urges South Korean Authorities to Stop Anti-DPRK Moves
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Urges South Korean Authorities to Stop Anti-DPRK Moves
 Pyongyang, October 21 (KCNA) -- The south Korean authorities' cooperation with outside forces in stifling the DPRK is a deliberate provocation against it prompted by their vicious plot to scupper the hard-won opportunity for improving the inter-Korean relations.
					 Rodong Sinmun Wednesday says in an article in this regard:
					
					 Cooperation with outside forces is intolerable.
					
					 It is none other than outside forces that have prevented the Korean nation from being reunified and forced it to suffer from national division century after century.
					
					 To rely on outside forces to settle the issue of Korea's reunification, an issue of taking back the sovereignty from them, is as foolish an act as putting the noose of subjugation around one's own neck.
					
					 One will be deserted by the nation and can never evade the heavy punishment by history if he or she cooperates with and relies on outside forces, keeping oneself away from one's nation.
					
					 Cooperation with outside forces will bring a war and ruin to the nation.
					
					 Inter-Korean relations can not improve as long as the south Korean authorities do not take the stand of national independence and patriotism to improve the relations and reunify the country, but persist in cooperation with outside forces in putting political and military pressure on the fellow countrymen in the DPRK.
					
					 It is advisable that they should stop their anachronistic cooperation with outside forces in pressuring the DPRK, bearing in mind that the U.S. hostile policy towards the DPRK is a prime cause of tense situation on the Korean Peninsula.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Calls for Concluding DPRK-U.S. Peace Treaty
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Calls for Concluding DPRK-U.S. Peace Treaty
 Pyongyang, October 21 (KCNA) -- The conclusion of a peace treaty between the DPRK and the U.S. presents itself as an urgent question the solution of which brooks no further delay for creating peaceful environment on the Korean Peninsula and ensuring global peace. 
					 Rodong Sinmun Wednesday observes this in an article.
					
					 The U.S. has mentioned nothing about the peace treaty while it is vociferating about "peace", floating misinformation that the DPRK's nuclear deterrent disturbs peace, the article notes, and goes on:
					
					 The Korean Peninsula requires durable peace, not tension, and to ensure peace on the peninsula is the unanimous desire of the Koreans and other world peace-loving people.
					
					 Clear is the stand of the DPRK. It is to defuse the danger of war and create peaceful environment on the peninsula at the earliest date and thus make a contribution to ensuring peace on the peninsula and in the rest of the world. 
					
					 To this end, the U.S. should roll back its anachronistic policy for keeping the armistice mechanism and respond to the DPRK's just proposal on concluding a peace treaty without delay.
					
					 If the U.S. boldly makes a policy switchover, the security environment on the peninsula will make a dramatic improvement and it will help clear its security concerns.
					
					 How the U.S. will approach the DPRK's proposal in the future would offer the world an important occasion of judging whether the former stands for peace or a war.
					
					 The U.S. would be well advised to bear this in mind and fulfill its commitments from a right position.

articles.title: Minju Joson Terms U.S. World's Biggest Human Rights Abuser
articles.content:
Minju Joson Terms U.S. World's Biggest Human Rights Abuser
 Pyongyang, October 21 (KCNA) -- A horrible shooting spree case has occurred at a university in Oregon State, the U.S. recently.
					 Gun-related crimes are so prevalent in the U.S. that even President Obama grumbled that mass murder by shooting spree has become a common occurrence in the U.S.
					
					 Commenting on this, Minju Joson Wednesday says the gun-related crimes getting ever more prevalent in the U.S. is a tragedy brought about by the U.S. politicians themselves.
					
					 But the U.S. politicians are shelving the situation of the country where lots of citizens become victims of gun-related crimes, and are calling hoarse on other countries to ensure "human rights", the news analyst says, and goes on:
					
					 There is a need for American politicians to come to their senses, though belatedly.
					
					 The international community has already branded the U.S. as the world's worst human rights abuser. The human rights situation in the U.S. has almost reached the state of festering beyond pitiful state.
					
					 No one knows what misfortune it will sustain if it continues to admonish others while styling itself the "human rights judge", feigning ignorance of the severity of the situation.
					
					 The U.S. had better be more concerned about ensuring its citizens the right to existence, and remove the cause of its internal trouble, before "worrying" about others.

articles.title: S. Korean Chief Executive Accused of Her Sycophantic Diplomacy
articles.content:
S. Korean Chief Executive Accused of Her Sycophantic Diplomacy
 Pyongyang, October 21 (KCNA) -- An editorial accusing the south Korean chief executive of her sycophantic diplomacy was posted on the south Korean internet paper Voice of People on Oct. 17.
					 It recalled that the chief executive toured the U.S., talking about "demonstration of solid alliance".
					
					 She officially advertised south Korea's admission to the TPP during her tour as a "success" but there is no reason whatsoever for it to accede to the TPP as it had already signed FTA with the U.S. and other countries, it noted.
					
					 The admission to the TPP would lead to the U.S.-Japan-south Korea alliance forced by the U.S., it charged.

articles.title: S. Korean Authorities Slammed for Moving to Introduce "State-compiled Textbook"
articles.content:
S. Korean Authorities Slammed for Moving to Introduce "State-compiled Textbook"
 Pyongyang, October 21 (KCNA) -- The south Korean Writers Association issued a statement in the name of 1 217 writers on Oct. 19 to denounce the conservative group for moving to introduce the "state-compiled history textbook", according to Voice of People, an internet paper of south Korea.
					 Such move kicked off by the regime is a tyrannical action for embellishing the pro-Japanese action and the past history of dictatorial power and writing off the history of democracy and independence, the statement said.
					
					 The history expressing the Japanese imperialists' pillage as "export" and killing as "punitive operation" is the one to be compiled by the regime, it noted.
					
					 The history cannot be a monopoly of a handful of those in power, it said.

articles.title: U.S. Urged to Opt for Signing Peace Treaty
articles.content:
U.S. Urged to Opt for Signing Peace Treaty
 Pyongyang, October 21 (KCNA) -- The People for Achieving Peace and Reunification in south Korea held a press conference in in Seoul on Oct. 16 to condemn the chief executives of the U.S. and south Korea for moving to tighten the alliance.
					 The stupid policy for confrontation aimed at "leading the north to change" should be rolled back in order to realize the denuclearization of the Korean Peninsula, the organization noted.
					
					 It demanded the U.S. opt for signing a peace treaty, clearly facing up to the reality, though belatedly.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un's Work Published in Russia
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un's Work Published in Russia
 Pyongyang, October 21 (KCNA) -- Supreme leader Kim Jong Un's work "Let Us Step Up the Building of a Thriving Country by Applying Kim Jong Il's Patriotism" was published in booklet by the Rosiski Pisateli Publishing House of Russia on October 9.
					 The work, published on July 26, Juche 101 (2012), deals with the essence of leader Kim Jong Il's patriotism and his noble life for the country and its people. It also clarifies important issues of embodying Kim Jong Il's patriotism.

articles.title: Peerlessly Great Men's Feats for Party-Building Praised by Foreign Political Parties
articles.content:
Peerlessly Great Men's Feats for Party-Building Praised by Foreign Political Parties 
 Pyongyang, October 21 (KCNA) -- Celebrations were held by political parties of different countries on the occasion of the 70th founding anniversary of the Workers' Party of Korea (WPK).
					 They included meetings by the People's Socialist Party of Mexico and the Communist Party of Malta, seminars by the Finnish Communists' League and the Nepal Worker-Peasant Party and round-table talks by the Malaysian People's Movement Party between Oct. 6 and 10.
					
					 Jesus Antonio Carlos Hernandez, general secretary of the C.C., the People's Socialist Party of Mexico, said in his speech that President Kim Il Sung founded the WPK on Oct. 10, 1945 and developed it into the ever-victorious party.
					
					 The international secretary of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of Malta said that the outstanding and tested leadership of Marshal Kim Jong Un, first secretary of the WPK, is an example of the socialist ruling party's leadership. 
					
					 Kalevi Wahrman, chairman of the Finnish Communists' League, noted that the WPK successfully played its role as the general staff of the Korean revolution and organizer and guide of all victories of the Korean people under the leadership of President Kim Il Sung and General Secretary Kim Jong Il. 
					
					 Narayan Man Bijukchhe, chairman of the Central Committee of the Nepal Worker-Peasant Party, noted that the seven decade-long history of the WPK is the one that won only victories in the revolution and construction under the leadership of Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il and the history of love that provided the people with genuine life and happiness.
					
					 The vice-president of the Malaysian People's Movement Party said that Kim Il Sung built the WPK into the party of the working people and led the Korean people to victory. 
					
					 Messages to Kim Jong Un were adopted at the events held in Finland and Nepal.

articles.title: WPK's Birthday Celebrated in Different Countries
articles.content:
WPK's Birthday Celebrated in Different Countries 
Pyongyang, October 21 (KCNA) -- Events took place in different countries on the occasion of the 70th founding anniversary of the Workers' Party of Korea (WPK).
					They included a reading session on leader Kim Jong Il's work at the Cotonou Institute of Journalism of Benin, seminar in Berlin, Germany and round-table talks and film show by the Ministry of Health of Angola between Oct. 5 and 7.
					
					The chairman of the Benin National Committee for the Study of the Juche Idea read out Kim Jong Il's work "The Workers' Party of Korea Organizes and Guides All the Victories of Our People".
					
					He said:
					
					Marshal Kim Jong Un is further developing the WPK into the party of President Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il.
					
					He is making immortal contributions to building a thriving socialist nation and realizing the cause of global independence while demonstrating the invincible spirit and might of Korea.
					
					The chairman of the Anti-Imperialist Forum of Germany said in a speech:
					
					President Kim Il Sung founded the immortal Juche idea, the guiding idea of the WPK, indicating the road to be followed by mankind.
					
					Kim Jong Il developed the WPK into the genuine mother party struggling for the people's interests, taking its root in them, and the powerful party emerging ever-victorious with the great idea and leadership, true to the behests of the President.
					
					The ever-victorious history of the WPK will be given steady continuity under the leadership of Kim Jong Un.

articles.title: WPK Founding Anniversary Celebrated in Angola, Thailand
articles.content:
WPK Founding Anniversary Celebrated in Angola, Thailand
 Pyongyang, October 21 (KCNA) -- Korean film shows were held in Angola and Thailand between Oct. 5 and 9 on the occasion of the 70th founding anniversary of the Workers' Party of Korea.
					 The participants watched Korean film "Pyongyang Today".

articles.title: WPK Introduced by Websites of Foreign Countries
articles.content:
WPK Introduced by Websites of Foreign Countries
 Pyongyang, October 21 (KCNA) -- Organizations of South Africa and Nigeria posted on their websites articles on the occasion of the 70th founding anniversary of the Workers' Party of Korea (WPK). 
					 The South African Group for the Study of Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism carried articles titled "Seven decades of leading people" and "The party praised by people" on Oct. 9.
					
					 An article titled "Invincibility of WPK" said that President Kim Il Sung organized and led the anti-Japanese armed struggle under the uplifted banner of the Juche idea and achieved the historic cause of Korea's liberation. 
					
					 The WPK is growing stronger into an invincible combat ranks under the leadership of leader Kim Jong Il who carried forward the idea and cause of the President, the article said, adding:
					
					 The WPK is highly demonstrating its invincible might as it is led by Marshal Kim Jong Un.
					
					 The Nigerian National Committee for the Study of Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism carried articles titled "Courage of leader Kim Jong Un" and "Blizzards of Paektu" on Oct. 1 and 8.
					
					 The articles praised him for glorifying the might of Korea in the world.

articles.title: WPK Praised by Russian Papers
articles.content:
WPK Praised by Russian Papers
 Pyongyang, October 21 (KCNA) -- Russian papers carried special write-ups and articles between Sept. 30 and Oct. 10 on the occasion of the 70th founding anniversary of the Workers' Party of Korea (WPK).
					 Khabarovsk Express carried an article illustrated with a photo of Marshal Kim Jong Un. Under the leadership of the WPK, the DPRK turned into a country in which people's dream and desire are coming true, the article noted, adding:
					
					 The WPK does not abandon its mission to realize the people's dream. The Korean people's dream of building a thriving socialist nation is neither a daydream nor a matter of distant future.
					
					 Trudovaya Tsumen carried an article titled "Seven decades of the WPK emerging ever-victorious".
					
					 The WPK is guided by Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism the essence of which is the Juche idea, Songun idea, the article noted, adding:
					
					 The single-minded unity provided by President Kim Il Sung was consolidated by leader Kim Jong Il.
					
					Kim Jong Un is carrying forward their idea and cause just as they are.
					
					 The WPK is winning victories and will emerge victorious in the future, too.
					
					 Our Home-Sochi in an article titled "Invincibility of WPK" praised the party leadership feats of Kim Il Sung, Kim Jong Il and Kim Jong Un.

articles.title: Russian Paper on Korean People's Efforts to Implement New Strategic Line
articles.content:
Russian Paper on Korean People's Efforts to Implement New Strategic Line
 Pyongyang, October 21 (KCNA) -- The Korean people have made efforts to realize the new strategic line set forth by Kim Jong Un, first chairman of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK.
					 The Russian paper Tsumenskaya Pravda said this in an article titled "New strategic line" on Oct. 8.
					
					 The Workers' Party of Korea set forth the line of simultaneously pushing forward economic construction and the building of nuclear force at the March 2013 Plenary Meeting of the WPK Central Committee.
					
					 The essence of the new strategic line calls for building a thriving nation while strengthening the self-supporting nuclear force for the country's defence capabilities and putting bigger efforts to economic construction. 
					
					 The line stems from the demand of the situation prevailing on the Korean Peninsula. 
					
					 The line will make it possible to put bigger investment in bolstering national defence capabilities and building economy.
					
					 The DPRK is neither Iraq nor Libya which obeyed the U.S. under its pressure.
					
					 The world will see how the DPRK mercilessly smashes the imperialists and their followers' moves to stifle it and build a prosperous and thriving nation by dint of powerful nuclear deterrence.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un recorre avenida de cientificos Mirae
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un recorre avenida de cientificos Mirae
 Pyongyang, 21 de octubre (ACNC) -- El Mariscal Kim Jong Un, Primer Secretario del Partido del Trabajo de Corea, Primer Presidente del Comite de Defensa Nacional de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea y Comandante Supremo del Ejercito Popular de Corea, recorrio la avenida de cientificos Mirae, construida excelentemente como modelo de la arquitectura Juche y paraiso de la epoca del PTC.
					   Mirando la avenida, el Mariscal dijo que cuanto mas vea tanto mas es maravillosa y elegante y expreso gran alegria recalcando que el reparto muestra de manera visual la idea del PTC de dar importancia a la ciencia y al personal calificado, armoniza perfectamente el caracter juccheano, la nacionalidad, la originalidad y el arte plastico. Tambien la califico de un reparto particular a nuestro estilo que se construyo en esta capital en la epoca en que florece mas plenamente la epoca de civilizacion.
					
					   A la luz del metodo existente de construccion es inimaginable levantar en un ano una avenida residencial para miles de familias y mas de 150 redes de servicio publico, senalo y asevero con emocion que esta avenida le da la seguridad de que nuestra patria, que avanza anticipando los 10 anos como un ano, se levantara con nuevo aspecto despues de 10 anos.
					
					   Estudio detalles de la labor constructiva recorriendo varios lugares de la avenida.
					
					   Es muy vistosa la torre simbolica que se instalo en la azotea del apartamento de 53 pisos de forma espiral para dar a conocer de lejos la avenida de cientificos Mirae, menciono y agrego que todos los edificios fueron construidos de manera artistica.
					
					   La calidad constructiva de viviendas es el maximo nivel, dijo y se mostro muy complacido subrayando que los profesores e investigadores pueden vivir alli sin traer otras cosas porque la sala comun, las habitaciones de padres, matrimonio e hijos, la cocina, etc. estan dotados de los muebles de buena calidad y los demas utensilios.
					
					   Al escuchar las palabras de los funcionarios de que las personas de otros paises no pudieran creer el hecho de que los ordinarios profesores y cientificos coreanos viviran aqui sin pagar ni un centavo en estas viviendas preparadas como palacio a la orilla del pintoresco rio Taedong, el Mariscal asevero que esto es precisamente la superioridad del regimen socialista de nuestro pais, nunca imitable ni inventable por el capitalismo.
					
					   Evaluo que instalaron con armonia y condecoraron magnificamente las redes de servicio comercial, gastronomico y publico e instalaciones de abastecimiento cultural en los primeros pisos de los edificios.
					
					   Se construyeron singularmente los lugares de descanso y los parques deportivos para que los habitantes descansen comodamente y hagan gimnasias, acoto el Mariscal y evaluo que se realizaron bien la reforestacion en la zona de viviendas y la obra de proteccion de la orilla del rio Taedong.
					
					   Enfatizo que el PTC tiene la firme voluntad de consolidar con mas firmeza con las ciencias la base socialista y llevar adelante el socialismo con la fuerza motriz de ciencias y destaco la necesidad de seguir aumentando la inversion eficaz a la rama de investigacion cientifica a base de los exitos y experiencias alcanzados en los ultimos anos en las labores para fortalecer la base material y tecnica de varios centros de investigacion cientifica y resolver los problemas pendientes en la vida de los cientificos e investigadores.
					
					   Todos los objetos arquitectonicos de la avenida construidos con la velocidad extraordinaria sin precedente en la historia de construccion devienen la creacion digna de la Corea del Songun levantada por nuestro ejercito y pueblo, que al responder con el trueno al relampago del Partido estan decididos a crear todo lo necesario a estilo coreano y por su propia cuenta guardando el optimismo en el futuro, y constituyen un precioso testimonio de su patriotismo invariable, enfatizo.
					
					   Dio agradecimiento en nombre del PTC a las unidades militares, entidades, los constructores y voluntarios que han participado en la construccion de la avenida.
					
					   Expreso la esperanza y conviccion de que poniendo de pleno manifiesto el indoblegable espiritu desplegado en la construccion de la avenida de cientificos Mirae todos los constructores haran un gran aportre a remodelar la ciudad de Pyongyang como centro de la cultura de Songun y como ciudad gigantesca y hermosa de talla mundial en todos los aspectos y a construir la patria socialista adecuada al pais civilizado.
					
					   El Mariscal dio la orden relativa a la inauguracion de la avenida.
					
					   Le acompanaron Hwang Pyong So, Kim Ki Nam, Kim Yang Gon, O Su Yong, Jo Yong Won y Ma Won Chun.

articles.title: Iniciado encuentro de familiares y parientes separados de Norte y Sur de Corea
articles.content:
Iniciado encuentro de familiares y parientes separados de Norte y Sur de Corea
Kumgangsan, 20 de octubre (ACNC) -- Gracias a la iniciativa y el caliente amor compatriota de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, se inicio en el monte Kumgang el encuentro de los familiares y parientes separados del Norte y el Sur de Corea.
					El dia 20 los habitantes de la RPDC se reunieron en colectivo con los familiares y parientes del Sur de Corea.
					
					Ellos recordaron los dias en que han venido trabajando con abnegacion por la prosperidad de la patria en el regazo de los grandes lideres y contaron a los consanguineos surcoreanos una vida feliz y digna de si mismos y sus familiares bajo el regimen socialista a estilo coreano centrado en las masas populares.
					
					Ese dia, la Sociedad de la Cruz Roja del Sur de Corea ofrecio un banquete en honor de los familiares y parientes separados en ambas partes.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam recibe cartas credenciales de embajador indio
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam recibe cartas credenciales de embajador indio
Pyongyang, 21 de octubre (ACNC) --  Jasminder Kasturia presento el dia 21 en el Palacio de los Congresos Mansudae ante Kim Yong Nam, presidente del Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, sus cartas credenciales que le acreditan como nuevo embajador extraordinario y plenipotenciario de la Republica de la India en la RPDC.
					Tras recibirlas, Kim departio con el diplomatico indio.

articles.title: Choe Thae Bok se reune con delegacion de grupo de parlamentarios de Alemania-Corea
articles.content:
Choe Thae Bok se reune con delegacion de grupo de parlamentarios de Alemania-Corea
Pyongyang, 21 de octubre (ACNC) -- El presidente de la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, Choe Thae Bok, se reunio el dia 21 en el Palacio de los Congresos Mansudae con la delegacion del grupo de los parlamentarios de Alemania-Corea presidida por Hartmut Koschyk, de visita en Corea.
